definition: an impostor/to impersonate
surname Mao
to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to assume sb's name and take his place (idiom); to impersonate/to pose under a false name
impersonator/impostor

sentences.english: They rang in a player in the game under a false name.
sentences.chinese: 他們偷偷塞進一名運動員冒名頂替參加比賽。

sentences.english: So that's the reason we basically assign it to pseudonymity.
sentences.chinese: 所以我們基本上都認爲這封信是冒名的。

sentences.english: Imposture is not allowed, violates will be punished as the regulation stipulates.
sentences.chinese: 體檢時，不得冒名代替，違者按有關規定予以處理。

sentences.english: Mira Wang, to recognize his own daughter to college impostor fact.
sentences.chinese: 王崢嶸承認自己的女兒冒名頂替上大學的事實。

sentences.english: It was only a question of a trifling substitution of names.
sentences.chinese: 那不過是一件小小的冒名頂替的事罷了。
那他們就都是冒名頂替者了。

sentences.english: The presidential impersonator has not been found.
sentences.chinese: 總統的冒名頂替者尚未被找到。

sentences.english: So notice this author--who I think is a pseudepigrapher.
sentences.chinese: 這個作者，我覺得他是冒名者。

sentences.english: Don't be fooled by impostors and copycats whose feeds keep getting disabled. This is the only offici…
sentences.chinese: 不要被愚弄的冒名頂替者和抄襲的飼料不斷得到禁用。

sentences.english: Remove the likes of the imposter.
The representative of register.com then sent the imposter a security code that he had to provide.
sentences.chinese: 的人員隨後請冒名頂替者提供所需的安全碼。

sentences.english: We discovered him to be an imposter.
sentences.chinese: 我們發現他是個冒名頂替的騙子。

sentences.english: The imposter is not even in the photo.
sentences.chinese: 該冒名頂替者甚至沒有在照片。

sentences.english: We believe they are pseudepigrapha; remember this from before?
sentences.chinese: 我們相信它們是冒名僞典，記得嗎？

sentences.english: the letter of Abgar to Jesus and of Jesus to Abgar, scholars call that pseudonymous.
sentences.chinese: 阿布加和耶穌之間的通信，學者稱其爲冒名信。

definition: to assume sb's name and take his place (idiom); to impersonate/to pose under a false name
to falsely use (sb's identity etc)
to forge/to fake/to counterfeit
to embezzle/to defraud/to use illegitimately/to misappropriate
to impersonate/to pose as (someone else)/to counterfeit/to palm off (a fake as a genuine)
to feign/to pretend to be/to pass oneself off as
to obtain by impersonation/to falsely claim as one's own
to defraud/to swindle
to gain by cheating
to cheat/to deceive
lit. to steal a rafter and replace it with a column/to replace the original with a fake/to perpetrate a fraud (idiom)

to make use of/to use sth as pretext/under false pretenses/under the guise of/masquerading as/lenient/tolerant/loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
to forge/fake/to fabricate (a story)
see 掉包[diao4 bao1]
to defraud/to swindle/to blackmail
to steal sb's valuable item and substitute a similar-looking but worthless item/to sell a fake for the genuine article/to palm off
